pageContext.claim: “My administration has also curtailed the harmful and intrusive use of federal consent decrees, which wrongly give meddlesome officials in Washington, D.C., immense authority to tie down local police departments and make it very difficult to do their work.”
pageContext.analysis: The evidence for Trump's claim is dubious at best. Federal consent decrees are used to increase police accountability in places where minorities have faced unconstitutional policing practices. They mostly require that police not infringe residents' constitutional rights and keep records of their interactions with the public.
